DataElement.preferredName: Controlled Oral Word Association Test Adjusted Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Total score for all three trials on the Controlled Oral Word Association Test (COWAT) adjusted for age and education level.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Controlled Oral Word Association Test Adjusted Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A test that measures the verbal fluency of an individual. This tool measures both semantic fluency and phonetic fluency._The act of making necessary corrections or modifications._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A test that measures the verbal fluency of an individual. This tool measures both semantic fluency and phonetic fluency.

Concepts.definition: A test that measures the verbal fluency of an individual. This tool measures both semantic fluency and phonetic fluency.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of making necessary corrections or modifications.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: The act of making necessary corrections or modifications.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created to curate COWAT data elements for Duke clinical trial.7.10.2016.dmr

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric score on a psychometric questionnaire or survey.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Assessment of psychological variables by the application of mathematical procedures.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The science of measuring "psychological" aspects of a person such as knowledge, skills, abilities, or personality. Measurement of these unobservable phenomena is difficult and much of the research and accumulated art of this discipline is designed to reliably define and then quantify.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Duke clinical trial CRF creation.7.10.2016.dmr
